intro: Verbesina glaucophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, silver-gray leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Verbesina glaucophylla is often found in dry, open habitats like prairies and woodland edges.
